    • UserController

      public UserController(UserService userService, UserStockService userStockService)
      Creates a new instance of the `UserController` class.
      Parameters:
      userService - The service for managing user data.
      userStockService - The service for managing user stocks.

  • Method Details

    • getAllUsersFromDatabase

      public List<User> getAllUsersFromDatabase()
      Retrieves a list of all users from the database.
      Returns:
      A list of User objects representing all users in the database.

    • getAllUsers

      @RequestMapping(value="/getAllUsers", method=GET) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity getAllUsers()
      Retrieves a list of all users from the database.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a list of User objects representing all users in the database with HTTP status OK if successful.

    • getUserByLastname

      @RequestMapping(value="/getUserByLastname", method=GET) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity getUserByLastname(@RequestParam String lastname)
      Retrieves user information based on the provided last name.
      Parameters:
      lastname - The last name of the user to retrieve information for.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing the user information in string format if found, or an error message with HTTP status NOT_FOUND if the user with the provided last name does not exist.

    • getUserByMail

      @RequestMapping(value="/getUserByMail", method=GET) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity getUserByMail(@RequestParam String mail)
      Retrieves user information based on the provided mail.
      Parameters:
      mail - The last name of the user to retrieve information for.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing the user information in string format if found, or an error message with HTTP status NOT_FOUND if the user with the provided last name does not exist.

    • checkUser

      @RequestMapping(value="/checkUser", method=GET) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity checkUser(@RequestParam String mail, @RequestParam String password) throws NoSuchAlgorithmException
      Checks the user's credentials by verifying the provided email and password.
      Parameters:
      mail - The email address of the user.
      password - The password for the user's account.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing the user object if the credentials are valid with HTTP status OK, or an error message with HTTP status NOT_ACCEPTABLE if the credentials are invalid or the user is not found.
      Throws:
      NoSuchAlgorithmException

    • addUser

      @RequestMapping(value="/addUser", method=PUT) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity addUser(@RequestParam String firstname, @RequestParam String lastname, @RequestParam String mail, @RequestParam String password, @RequestParam boolean mail_service) throws NoSuchAlgorithmException
      Adds a new user to the system with the provided information.
      Parameters:
      firstname - The first name of the user.
      lastname - The last name of the user.
      mail - The email address of the user.
      password - The password for the user's account.
      mail_service - A boolean flag indicating whether the user wants to receive email notifications.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a success message if the user was added successfully, or an error message with HTTP status NOT_ACCEPTABLE if the user already exists.
      Throws:
      NoSuchAlgorithmException

    • updateUserPassword

      @RequestMapping(value="/updateUserPassword", method=PUT) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity updateUserPassword(@RequestParam String mail, @RequestParam String old_password, @RequestParam String new_password) throws NoSuchAlgorithmException
      Updates the password for a user with the provided email address.
      Parameters:
      mail - The email address of the user.
      old_password - The old password for the user's account.
      new_password - The new password to set for the user's account.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing the updated user object if the password is successfully updated with HTTP status OK, or an error message with HTTP status NOT_ACCEPTABLE if the user is not found or the old password is incorrect.
      Throws:
      NoSuchAlgorithmException

    • deleteUsers

      @RequestMapping(value="/deleteAllUsers", method=GET) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity deleteUsers()
      Deletes all users.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a success message if all users have been successfully deleted with HTTP status OK, or an error message with HTTP status NOT_ACCEPTABLE if the users were not found.

    • deleteUserByMail

      @RequestMapping(value="/deleteUserByMail", method=GET) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity deleteUserByMail(@RequestParam String mail, @RequestParam String password) throws NoSuchAlgorithmException
      Deletes a user with the provided email address.
      Parameters:
      mail - The email address of the user and the password.
      password - The password to confirm the deletion.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a success message if the user has been successfully deleted with HTTP status OK, or an error message with HTTP status NOT_ACCEPTABLE if the user was not found.
      Throws:
      NoSuchAlgorithmException

    • getAllUserStocks

      @RequestMapping(value="/getAllUserStocks", method=GET) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity getAllUserStocks()
      Retrieves a list of all user stocks from the database.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a list of UserStock objects representing all user stocks in the database with HTTP status OK if successful.

    • getStocksForUser

      @RequestMapping(value="/getStocksForUser", method=GET) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity getStocksForUser(@RequestParam String mail, @RequestParam String password) throws NoSuchAlgorithmException
      Retrieves a list of all user stocks for the user with the provided email address.
      Parameters:
      mail - The email address of the user.
      password - The password for the user's account.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a list of UserStock objects representing all user stocks for the user with HTTP status OK if successful, or an error message with HTTP status NOT_ACCEPTABLE if the user does not exist.
      Throws:
      NoSuchAlgorithmException

    • addUserStock

      @RequestMapping(value="/addUserStock", method=PUT) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity addUserStock(@RequestParam String mail, @RequestParam String password, @RequestParam String stockSymbol) throws NoSuchAlgorithmException
      Adds a new user stock subscription with the provided user credentials and stock symbol.
      Parameters:
      mail - The email address of the user.
      password - The password for the user's account.
      stockSymbol - The symbol of the stock to subscribe to.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity with a success message if the subscription is added successfully with HTTP status OK, or an error message with HTTP status NOT_ACCEPTABLE if the user does not exist or is already subscribed.
      Throws:
      NoSuchAlgorithmException

    • deleteUserStock

      @RequestMapping(value="/deleteUserStock", method=GET) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity deleteUserStock(@RequestParam String mail, @RequestParam String password, @RequestParam String stockSymbol) throws NoSuchAlgorithmException
      Deletes a user stock subscription with the provided user credentials and stock symbol.
      Parameters:
      mail - The email address of the user.
      password - The password for the user's account.
      stockSymbol - The symbol of the stock to unsubscribe from.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity with a success message if the subscription is deleted successfully with HTTP status OK, or an error message with HTTP status NOT_ACCEPTABLE if the user does not exist or is not subscribed.
      Throws:
      NoSuchAlgorithmException

    • deleteUserStocksByMail

      @RequestMapping(value="/deleteUserStocksByMail", method=GET) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity deleteUserStocksByMail(@RequestParam String mail, @RequestParam String password) throws NoSuchAlgorithmException
      Deletes all user stock subscriptions with the provided user credentials.
      Parameters:
      mail - The email address of the user.
      password - The password for the user's account.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity with a success message if the subscription is deleted successfully with HTTP status OK, or an error message with HTTP status NOT_ACCEPTABLE if the user does not exist or is not subscribed.
      Throws:
      NoSuchAlgorithmException
